page.title: 02FOOTPATHS
page.content: First we went to Mill House to interview Mrs Butter. She said "footpaths started by farmers taking their grain to be ground at the mills". Then we interviewed a young lady . She said footpaths are useful because they are safer than walking on the road. Another old lady said footpaths are not useful because it encouraged strangers to come to the village and she didn't like this. Most of the footpaths are closed and their are no identification boards to show where they begin or the direction they take. One of our group was hit by old lady who insisted that the footpaths, clearly shown on our map, did not exist.
